result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob J. Bowersox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jacob J. Bowersox in court with attorney Brian Severson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Severson agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Severson makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
*Court orders 30 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
  Report on or before January 18, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
*Court Costs = $268.00
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

Court gives the defendant 48 hours to report to the Probation office due to it being closed today.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-17-2015 11:00 am

Final pre-trial at 11-06-2015 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 12-10-2015 08:30 am.

Defendant Jacob J. Bowersox in court with attorney Brian Severson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel agree matter should be set for trial.
BY THE COURT:  Trial set.  Bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Return date at 07-22-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Jacob J. Bowersox in court with attorney Brian Severson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Severson states they are not sure yet if they are taking the offer by the DA.  Requests trial be set.  Court questions Atty Severson.  Atty Severson agrees to a return date.
BY THE COURT:  Reset.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Return date at 06-03-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Jacob J. Bowersox in court with attorney Brian Severson.  Tania Marie Bonnett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Severson states that he missed the pre-trial conference due to the mail and asks for a new pre-trial and a reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.
Atty Severson will contact the DA's office to set up a pre-trial.  Return date scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Atty Brian Severson - SBN 1042868
Appointed 03-10-15
Return date at 04-23-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Jacob J Bowersox in court with attorney Brian Severson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Severson; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Severson agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.
Atty Severson enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jacob J Bowersox in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that he has a conflict and will be reappointing counsel on this case.  Atty Gumz asks for a reset of the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Reset to give time for PD to reappoint counsel.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Atty Gumz received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Hendee requests signature bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.

Defendant Jacob J Bowersox in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states defendant turned himself in today.  Requests warrant be quashed.  BY THE COURT:  Court will quash warrant.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 11:30 am.
